subsection.name: Execute
subsection.p: Define an execute method. The definition of Execute annotation is as follows.
Specify whether this method is validated by annotation. The default value is true.
If validate attribute is true, you must define input attribute as follows.
Specify the path when validation errors have occurred.
Specify the invoked reset method when this execute method is invoked.
Specify the required roles when this execute method is invoked.

subsection.name: Required
subsection.p: Define mandatory validation. The definition of Required annotation is as follows.

Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
The default value is @Msg(key = "errors.required").
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: Validwhen
subsection.p: Define validation for checking one property against another. "antlr.jar" is required.
Specify the boolean expression as follows.
Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.
Specify the array of Arg annotations.
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: Minlength
subsection.p: Validate that input data isn't less than a specified minimum length.
Specify a minimum length.

Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
The default value is @Msg(key = "errors.minlength").
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.

Specify the second argument of message.
The default value is @Arg(key = "${var:minlength}"
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: Maxlength
subsection.p: Validate that input data doesn't exceed a specified maximum length.
Specify a maximum length.

Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
The default value is @Msg(key = "errors.maxlength").
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.

Specify the second argument of message.
The default value is @Arg(key = "${var:maxlength}".
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: Mask
subsection.p: Validate format according to a regular expression. "jakarta-oro.jar" is required.
Specify a regular expression.

Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
The default value is @Msg(key = "errors.invalid").
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.
Specify the array of Arg annotations.
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: IntRange
subsection.p: Validate that an integer field is within a specified range.
Specify a minimum value.
Specify a maximum value.

Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
The default value is @Msg(key = "errors.range").
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.

Specify the second argument of message.
The default value is @Arg(key = "${var:min}".
See Arg annotation.

Specify the third argument of message.
The default value is @Arg(key = "${var:max}".
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: UrlType
subsection.p: Validate url format.

Specify whether all schemes are allowed.
The default value is false.

Specify whether double '/' characters are allowed.
The default value is false.

Specify whether fragements are allowed.
The default value is false(allowed).

Specify a comma separated list of valid schemes.
The default value is "http,https,ftp".

Specify the displayed message when validation errors have occurred.
The default value is @Msg(key = "errors.url").
See Msg annotation.

Specify the first argument of message.
The default value is same as property name.
See Arg annotation.
Specify the execute method name for validation target. If you don't specify this attribute, execute methods that validate attribute is true are target.

subsection.name: Msg
subsection.p: Define a message.
If resource attribute is true, specify the key registered in message resource(application.properties). If resource attribute is false, specify the message itself.
Specify whether the message is registered in message resource(application.properties). The default value is true.
Specify the resource bundle.

subsection.name: Arg
subsection.p: Define an argument of a message.
If resource attribute is true, specify the key registered in message resource(application.properties). If resource attribute is false, specify the message itself.
If you specify ${var:"variable name"} like @Arg(key = "${var:minlength}", resource = false), the value of variable is applied
Specify whether the message is registered in message resource(application.properties). The default value is true.
Specify the resource bundle.
Specify the position of argument. It starts with zero.
